definition: to tighten up (restrictions etc)
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Second, local governments and enterprises are worried that the credit policy could be tightened.
sentences.chinese: 第二，地方政府和企业担心未来信贷政策会收紧。

sentences.english: The fisherman tightens the birds' collars to keep them from swallowing their catches.
sentences.chinese: 渔夫收紧鸬鹚的脖套，防止它们吞下捕捉到的猎物。

sentences.english: So my consciousness narrows and constricts, and I'm in the "fight or flight" mode.
sentences.chinese: 我的意识变得狭窄，收紧，进入“对抗或逃跑“模式。

sentences.english: When trying a new bra, always fasten the middle or loosest hook.
sentences.chinese: 试新文胸时，要收紧中间或松开钩子。

sentences.english: Tea that contains tanin can be used to tighten the membranes in the throat as well reduce itch when consumed as well.
sentences.chinese: 含有塔宁的茶水也可用于收紧喉咙膜，减轻喉咙痒痛。

sentences.english: Accelerated by gravity, a bird closes its wings and plunges at quarry.
sentences.chinese: 通过重力来加速，隼收紧翅膀飞向猎物。

sentences.english: The officer asked us to stand straight and keep stomach muscles in.
sentences.chinese: 长官要求我们站直并收紧腹肌。

sentences.english: Do not tense your shoulders as you do this.
sentences.chinese: 当你做这个动作时，不要收紧肩胛骨。

sentences.english: We have to suck in our bellies for a period.
sentences.chinese: 我们得收紧裤带，过一段时间的清苦日子了。

sentences.english: Press your shoulders down and push your scapulae together. Release and repeat 15 times.
sentences.chinese: 放下肩膀收紧肩胛骨，如此重复15次。

sentences.english: Please catch in the waistline slightly.
The four screw bolts should be tightened up in turn in asymmetrically diagonal position.
sentences.chinese: 四只螺栓要对称地成斜对角情势依次收紧。

sentences.english: The free end is provided with a fixing block or a poise for frapping the elastic thread.
sentences.chinese: 自由端上设有收紧弹性线的固定卡或砝码。

sentences.english: Abdominal legs buttocks tightened, inter-ministerial body to stimulate the right side of bending.
sentences.chinese: 腹部腿部臀部收紧，跨部带动身体向右侧弯曲。

sentences.english: Several pleats on one side cinched the waist.
sentences.chinese: 身体一侧的几处褶皱收紧了腰身。

sentences.english: It needs tightening up a little.

definition: to tighten/to contract/to shrink in
(economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
money market/money
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to loosen/to relax
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to relax (policy)/relaxed
central bank
abbr. for various central banks, notably 中國人民銀行|中国人民银行[Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Yin2 hang2] and 中央銀行|中央银行[Zhong1 yang1 Yin2 hang2]
to rise (i.e. number increases)/a price rise/to raise
flowing/shifting/fluidity/mobility/liquidity (of funds)
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
credit/borrowed money
to regulate/to control
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
to untie/(fig.) to ease restrictions
